title: Bug 47910 - ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description: The output file created by the 'ajc' command does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file, even though there is a METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file present in the project directory.
OB: When using the 'ajc' command with the 'sourceroots' and 'outjar' parameters to compile and package source files into a JAR file, the resulting JAR file does not include the expected MANIFEST.MF file. This makes the generated JAR file invalid.
EB: The 'ajc' command with the 'outjar' parameter should create a valid JAR file, which includes a MANIFEST.MF file.
SR: To reproduce:1. Call the 'ajc' command with the 'sourceroots' parameter specifying the project directory.2. Use the 'outjar' parameter to specify the output file name with a .jar extension.3. Verify that the generated JAR file does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file, even though there is a METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file present in the project directory.
